projectTitle: How to correctly backup and encrypt directories
description: This short project is a basic setup I came up with to make encrypted backups on a schedule, how to manage the encryption keys, and lastly, send email notifications reporting status codes.

foodcloseto.me is an aggregator website that mines the yelp fusion API for restaurants in Austin, TX. The project was deployed to GCP, but now I host it on my personal server. This was a 4 person project
tools: Google Cloud Platform and then nginx self hosting, Gunicorn, Flask, SQL-Alchemy, Jinja2, Bootsrap, HTML, JS, CSS, Travis-CI, autopep8, coverage, pylint

description: The Robot Operating system library is a fantastic way to learn about robotics. But sometimes getting the hardware necessary to do so can be difficult. This is a research project for Cyber-Physical Systems in which I am producing a simulator that runs on the Kivy graphics library to simulate a f1/10 lidar-based automated vehicle . This allows for students study and program PID controllers without having to wait for a turn to use one of the 2 vehicles we have at UT. The code used in the simulator can be ported to the real vehicle.

There are many ways to implement login in flask, but this is my prefered methos using Flask-Login. This allows for safe and flexible cookie management. This is also an example on how to use Flask-Alchemy as part of the login process and hashed-password storage

projectTitle: Control a lightswitch via a self hosted website
description: This is a easy to follow tutorial on how to move a light switch connected to a servo motor using a raspberry pi in your local network

Similar to foodcloseto.me, this aggregator website collects data from different sources. However I am working alone on this project and it should have better and more complex features such as fully dynamic data mining, additionally  I do intend to build a tool with more intrinsic value rather than just a practice project
tools: self-hosted, nginx, uWSGI, Flask, SQL-Alchemy, Jinja2, Bootsrap, HTML, JS, CSS, autopep8, coverage, pylint
